sn55.2:3.1: 2 The Culmination of the Spiritual Life
sn55.2:4.1: “Mendicants, a noble disciple who has four things is a stream-enterer, not liable to be reborn in the underworld, bound for awakening.
sn55.2:5.2: It’s when a noble disciple has experiential confidence in the Buddha …
sn55.2:5.6: And they have the ethical conduct loved by the noble ones …
sn55.2:5.8: A noble disciple who has these four things is a stream-enterer, not liable to be reborn in the underworld, bound for awakening.”
sn55.2:6.1: This is what the Buddha said.
sn55.2:6.2: Then the Holy One, the Teacher, went on to say:
sn55.2:7.2: confidence, and vision of the truth,
sn55.2:7.4: the culmination of the spiritual life.”
